text.text: How do I access the Accounting Periods option in ZOLL Billing?

text: To access the Accounting Periods option in ZOLL Billing, click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. The system provides help and guidance the first time you go through the closing process.

text.text: What does ZOLL Billing automatically record in accounting periods?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically records all posted charges, payments, and adjustments to the appropriate accounting period. Managers can use the information in the accounting periods to reconcile billing charges, transactions, and adjustments with monthly closing reports.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of using accounting periods in ZOLL Billing?

text: The charges, payments, and adjustments are in flux until you close the period; once closed, you cannot make modifications to that period.

text.text: How do I navigate to the Accounting Periods page?

text: To get started, click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar. The system provides help and guidance the first time you go through the closing process. Take the time to read the information before proceeding.

text.text: What information can I find in the Charges column of the Accounting Periods page?

text: The Charges column represents the charge transactions assigned to the trip dates in the current accounting period. You can click this link to view items that makeup this value.

text.text: What does the Payments column represent in the Accounting Periods page?

text: The Payments column represents the total amount of payments received during this accounting period.

text.text: Can you clarify the meaning of Credit Adjustments in the Accounting Periods page?

text: Credit adjustments are transactions that happened within the current period but have a service / trip date that is prior to the current period.

text.text: What is the significance of the Previous balance and balance forward fields on the Accounting Periods page?

text: The Accounting Periods page displays the balance of the previous period and the balance that will be forward to the next open period. The system continually updates fields on the Accounting Periods page. To see the most current data, refresh your browser.

text.text: How can I access reports for closed accounting periods in ZOLL Billing?

text: There are four reports available for closed periods that you can access by clicking "Download reports". A zip file opens with three .csv files that shows adjustments, charts, and payments. In addition, you will see an accounting period summary report that provides information on: the payer, the number of claims, the billing charged amount, contractual allowances, net charges, payments, revenue adjustments, write-offs, refunds, balance, net charges per claim.

text.text: What information is included in the accounting period summary report provided by ZOLL Billing?

text: The accounting period summary report provides information on: the payer, the number of claims, the billing charged amount, contractual allowances, net charges, payments, revenue adjustments, write-offs, refunds, balance, net charges per claim.

text.text: how the system assigns items to a specific accounting period,?

text: When a user adds a charge to a claim with a date of service that falls within a closed accounting period, the system assigns the charge to the oldest open period. When an adjustment request comes in for a payer, the system posts the adjustment to an accounting period.

text.text: What are the  Accounting Period Columns?

text: The Accounting Period Columns are: Charges, Payments, Credits, Charge Adjustments, Credit Adjustments.

text.text: accounting period summary report that provides information on?

text: The accounting period summary report provides information on: the payer, the number of claims, the billing charged amount, contractual allowances, net charges, payments, revenue adjustments, write-offs, refunds, balance, net charges per claim.
